about.subtitle: We are building structured, transparent digital payment rails — reducing cash dependency and strengthening economic circulation within Haiti.

founding.title: Why We Built KobKlein
founding.p1: Haiti remains heavily cash-dependent, with limited access to formal financial services. At the same time, the Haitian diaspora sends billions of dollars annually in remittances — funds that often enter the economy through high-cost, cash-based channels.
founding.p2: KobKlein was founded to bridge this gap. Our objective is not simply to move money — but to convert remittance inflows into structured digital purchasing power that supports families, merchants, and local economic growth.
founding.p3: We are building with patience, institutional discipline, and a partner-first compliance model. Our platform connects diaspora capital to secure digital wallets and merchant networks, increasing transparency and reducing cash risk.

problem.label: The Challenge
problem.text: Cash-dependent economy, limited digital financial infrastructure, and high-cost remittance channels

solution.label: Our Approach
solution.text: Partner-first digital wallet with transparent pricing, K-Agent distribution network, and AML/KYC compliance framework

reach.label: Our Focus
reach.text: Haiti, U.S., Canada, France, and diaspora communities worldwide

about.missionCard: To expand secure, transparent, and accessible digital financial tools for Haitians — reducing cash dependency while strengthening merchant-driven economic circulation within Haiti and its diaspora.
